content: It's nowhere near as bad as we thought, @Josh Mandel . There's a hardware option, too - you can plug a wireless dongle into your computer that transmits to the projector.

We use these at our company and they work pretty well. Another option (maybe) is if the projector or big-screen TV supports Apple's AirPlay or if it supports the Miracast protocol you might be able to wirelessly send your device's screen to it.

https://www.howtogeek.com/177145/wireless-display-standards-explained-airplay-miracast-widi-chromecast-and-dlna/

@Michael Donnelly FYI, there's also this 'cheap' dongle that supports AirPlay and Miracast that is inexpensive and can be picked up at WalMart (and surely other places): https://www.walmart.com/ip/WiFi-Wireless-HDMI-Display-Dongle-TV-AV-Adapter-Miracast-DLNA-Airplay-Receiver/740836231
